item.description:
Join us for the second day of community cooking at the cob oven at New Eden gardens in Newbury! We will wrap up the two-day cooking event with a potluck feast starting at 4:00PM. Please join us for any portion of the event!

The oven will be stoked up again Sunday morning and will be hot enough for pizza at noon followed by pies, veggies, breads and more until the feast at 4:pm.

Please contact Erin Stack erinstack@comcast.net or 978-807-6315 to reserve a baking time so she can make sure everyone’s food has a space in the oven at the right temperature.

If your time is short, you may drop off food for the feast and the oven tenders will cook it for you! Salads and other non-baked dishes would be welcome additions to the potluck menu.

There is a suggested $5 donation to offset the cost of the oven and support the groups environmental mission.

This promises to be a fun, educational and tasty experience!

Presented as a collaboration between New Eden Community Gardens, First Parish Church, Transition Newburyport and North Shore Permaculture.
item.how_to_find_us: In the parking lot behind the church and you will see the oven crowd
item.name: Cob Oven Community Cooking Day Two
